header.title: Le Véritable Dragon Rouge
header.category: Grimoire Tradition, Western Esotericism, Black Magic

central_thesis: The book presents itself as a practical guide to commanding various types of spirits (infernal, aerial, terrestrial) and performing diverse magical operations, including necromancy, astrological divination, treasure discovery, and personal enhancement through a combination of traditional grimoire techniques, planetary magic, and folk remedies, emphasizing the efficacy of making pacts.

structure_content.chapter_title: AVANT-PROPOS
structure_content.summary: Justifies the pursuit of hidden sciences and the discovery of secrets, positioning the book as a means to understand the universe and human faculties beyond the mundane.

structure_content.chapter_title: CHAPITRE PREMIER. DU IL EST TRAITÉ DE LA BAGUETTE FOUDROYANTE ET MYSTÉRIEUSE, DE SA VÉRITABLE COMPOSITION POUR TROUVER LES TRÉSORS.
structure_content.summary: Describes how to create and use a divining rod (baguette foudroyante) from a hazelnut branch for locating hidden treasures, metals, or water. It details how the wand reacts to various conditions and mentions an accompanying invocation.

structure_content.chapter_title: CHAPITRE II. CE QUE SONT D'APRÈS LA MAGIE D'ARBATEL LES ESPRITS CÉLESTES
structure_content.summary: Introduces the seven Olympian planetary spirits (Aratron, Bethor, Phaleg, Och, Hageth, Ophiel, Phul), detailing their attributes, powers (e.g., Aratron grants alchemy, invisibility; Bethor prolongs life, transports objects; Phaleg governs Mars, military; Och presides over Sun, health; Hageth influences Venus, beauty, transmutes copper; Ophiel transmutes mercury; Phul governs Moon, cures), and provides their unique sigils.

structure_content.chapter_title: CHAPITRE III. DE CE QU'IL FAUT PENSER DANS LES CHOSES D'INVOCATION.
structure_content.summary: Discusses the necessary mindset and preparation for invocation, emphasizing honesty and purity. Outlines 'seven greatest secrets' related to healing, longevity, understanding natural elements, achieving high faculties, submission to God, divine recognition, and resurrection.

structure_content.chapter_title: CHAPITRE IV. TOUCHANT LES PACTES FAITS AVEC LE DIABLE.
structure_content.summary: Explores the nature of pacts with demons, the existence of demons, and various forms of necromancy to evoke the dead (citing historical examples like Saul and Samuel), as well as different types of divination.

structure_content.chapter_title: DIVINATION PAR LES CORPS CÉLESTES, AUTREMENT APPELÉE ASTROLOGIE.
structure_content.summary: Details astrological principles, describing the influences of the planets (Sun, Moon, Mars, Mercury, Jupiter, Venus, Saturn) on human life, and the characteristics of the twelve celestial houses (zodiac signs) in relation to fate and personality.

structure_content.chapter_title: CHAPITRE V. CONTINUATION TOUCHANT LES PLANÈTES ET HOROSCOPES TIRÉS D'ICELLES.
structure_content.summary: Continues the discussion on planetary influences, detailing their specific 'houses' or domains (e.g., Aries/Scorpio for Mars, Taurus/Libra for Venus) and providing the sigils for the seven Olympian spirits again.

structure_content.chapter_title: LE SECRETA SECRETORUM, AUTREMENT DIT LES SECRETS DES SECRETS.
structure_content.summary: A brief introduction to the 'secrets of the black hen,' presenting it as a rare and powerful secret.

structure_content.chapter_title: CHAPITRE VI. OU ON TRAITE DES EXORCISMES, C'EST-À-DIRE DES MOYENS A EMPLOYER POUR CHASSER LE DÉMON.
structure_content.summary: Provides methods and specific Latin incantations for exorcising demons, compelling them to obey, and for protection against malevolent spirits, thunder, storms, and winds.

structure_content.chapter_title: CHAPITRE VII. DU MIROIR SECRET DE SALOMON, MANIÈRE DE FAIRE LE MIROIR DE SALOMON.
structure_content.summary: Instructions for creating and using a scrying mirror (made from polished steel or silver), involving specific rituals, invocations of divine and angelic names (Jehova, Elion, Mitraton, Adonay, Anael), and purification rites over 48 days to enable vision into hidden matters.

structure_content.chapter_title: SECRET DE LA POULE NOIRE.
structure_content.summary: Details a ritual involving a black hen (which has never laid an egg) to discover hidden treasures. It includes specific timing, location (crossroads), an invocation to Eloim, and describes the appearance of a spirit.

structure_content.chapter_title: LE SANCTUM REGUM OU LA VÉRITABLE MANIÈRE DE FAIRE DES PACTES AVEC QUELQUE ESPRIT QUE CE SOIT SANS QU'IL PUISSE VOUS FAIRE AUCUN TORT.
structure_content.summary: Introduces the principles of pact-making, asserting that true pacts can be made without harm, implying a distinction from purely malefic pacts.

structure_content.chapter_title: CLAVICULE DU GRAND ROI SALOMON
structure_content.summary: This substantial section outlines how to make a pact with infernal spirits. It lists the principal infernal emperors (Lucifer, Belzebuth, Astaroth) and their grand ministers (Lucifuge Rofocale, Satanachia, Agaliarept, Fleurety, Sargatanas, Nebiros), describing their powers and how to summon them. It includes detailed instructions for drawing the magical circle, specific invocations for Lucifuge Rofocale, the terms of the pact (20 years of service in exchange for treasures), and the renvoi (dismissal) of the spirit.

structure_content.chapter_title: SECRETS TOUCHANT LES PANTACLES ET TALISMANS
structure_content.summary: Explains the creation and use of pantacles and talismans, specifying materials (metals), planetary days, colors, suffumigations, and inscriptions (Hebraic letters, divine names). Describes the general purpose of talismans (protection, good fortune, love, health, invisibility) and specifically mentions the Ring of Gyges for invisibility.

structure_content.chapter_title: CHAPITRE VIII. SECRETS TOUCHANT LA PHY-SIONOMIE SUIVANT UN AUTEUR ITALIEN TRES-ANCIEN ET FORT SAVANT.
structure_content.summary: A non-magical interlude, detailing characteristics of individuals based on their physical appearance (e.g., the handsome man, the ingenious man, the inconstant man, the courageous man, the rash man, the gluttonous man, the jealous man, the envious man).

structure_content.chapter_title: CHAPITRE IX. LES SECRETS DE LA REINE CLÉOPATRE
structure_content.summary: Another non-magical section offering beauty recipes, including skin care treatments, anti-aging solutions, and remedies for eruptions, using ingredients like watercress, milk, honey, various oils, and plant juices.

structure_content.chapter_title: SECRET POUR SE RENDRE INVISIBLE
structure_content.summary: Provides a ritual for achieving invisibility, which involves an onyx ring engraved with specific symbols, prepared under certain planetary influences, reinforcing the earlier mention of the Ring of Gyges.

structure_content.chapter_title: CHAPITRE X. LES SECRETS DU SAVANT ARTÉPHIUS.
structure_content.summary: Attributes knowledge of alchemy and astrology to Artephius, presenting further planetary sigils to be used for magical operations on corresponding days (Sun/Sunday, Moon/Monday, Mars/Tuesday, Mercury/Wednesday, Jupiter/Thursday, Venus/Friday, Saturn/Saturday), detailing the specific powers associated with each planet.

structure_content.chapter_title: CHAPITRE XI. DES CHOSES ÉMERVEILLABLES, PRÉJUGÉS, ETC., ETC.
structure_content.summary: A compilation of folk beliefs, superstitions, and simple remedies or divinatory practices for everyday concerns such as good luck, protection, health, and love, including practices like sowing parsley, carrying a dead person's silver coin, various customs related to marriage, and a 'Tréfoir' (Christmas Eve ritual).

structure_content.chapter_title: CONCLUSION!
structure_content.summary: Concluding remarks encouraging the reader's continued study and application of the secrets revealed in the book.

structure_content.chapter_title: TABLE:
structure_content.summary: Table of contents.

key_concepts.definition: A divining rod, typically a forked hazelnut branch, used to locate hidden treasures, water, or minerals through its natural (or induced) sympathetic reactions.
Seven planetary intelligences (Aratron, Bethor, Phaleg, Och, Hageth, Ophiel, Phul) from the Arbatel tradition, each governing a planet and possessing specific magical attributes and powers.

A central operative system where a practitioner enters into a contractual agreement with powerful demons (e.g., Lucifuge Rofocale) for material gain (treasures), services, or knowledge, often involving sacrifices and precise conjurations within a protective circle.
A protective boundary drawn on the ground, often with specific inscriptions, used by the magician to safely conjure and command spirits.

key_concepts.term: Miroir Secret de Salomon (Secret Mirror of Solomon)
key_concepts.definition: A scrying mirror, typically made of polished metal, consecrated over a period of days with divine and angelic invocations, used for clairvoyance and obtaining hidden knowledge.
A specific ritual involving a black hen that has never laid an egg, sacrificed at crossroads at midnight, to compel a spirit to reveal hidden treasures.

Magical objects, often metal plates or rings, engraved with specific symbols (divine names, sigils) according to planetary and astrological correspondences, consecrated for specific purposes such as protection, invisibility, or attracting desired outcomes.
Rites and invocations, often in Latin, aimed at expelling demonic entities or compelling them to obey the magician's will, ensuring safety and control.
The art of communicating with the dead to gain knowledge, involving specific conjurations and often associated with pacts or the evocation of specific shades.

practical_system.description: The system outlined in 'Le Véritable Dragon Rouge' is a composite of Solomonic-style ceremonial magic, planetary invocations (from Arbatel), and folk magic traditions. Its core operative method involves conjuration of spirits (both infernal and celestial) through specific incantations, the use of consecrated magical tools, and the creation of protective circles. A significant emphasis is placed on formal pact-making with infernal entities to secure their services, particularly for treasure acquisition, but also for invisibility, divination, and other desires. The text also includes detailed instructions for constructing ritual objects like the Secret Mirror of Solomon and various talismans, each aligned with specific planetary or spiritual forces. The rituals often demand specific timing (moon phases, days of the week, midnight), material components (virgin parchment, hazelnut branches, animal sacrifices), and a resolute mindset from the practitioner.
tools: Baguette Foudroyante (divining rod, typically hazelnut branch)
Cercle Magique (triple-lined protective circle with inscriptions)
Secret Mirror of Solomon (polished steel or silver mirror)
Sacrificial Animals (black hen, implicitly a goat)
Suffumigations (male frankincense, mastic resin, aloe wood, charcoal)
rituals: Conjuration and Pacts: Involves drawing a triple magical circle with specific inscriptions, performing invocations to Lucifer, Belzebuth, and Astaroth (as superiors), and then directly to specific ministers like Lucifuge Rofocale. The spirit is compelled to appear and offer a pact (e.g., 20 years of service for riches), which the practitioner must sign in blood on virgin parchment, offering their soul as collateral. Precise renvoi (dismissal) rituals are provided to ensure the spirit departs without harm.

Treasure Finding (Baguette Foudroyante): Involves preparing a forked hazelnut branch cut on a specific day (Wednesday or Saturday) before sunrise. The rod is split and rejoined with specific ligatures, then held to locate hidden treasures, metals, or water based on its movements.

Treasure Finding (La Poule Noire): A highly specific ritual requiring a black hen that has never laid an egg. The hen is taken to crossroads at midnight, killed with an invocation ('Eloim, Eloim, Eloim'), and then buried. A spirit appears to guide the magician to treasure.

Scrying (Miroir Secret de Salomon): Constructing a polished metal (steel or silver) mirror, consecrating it over 48 days with daily prayers and invocations of divine names (Jehova, Elion, Mitraton, Adonay, Anael), suffumigations, and a sign of the cross, to enable visions and revelations.

Talismanic Magic: Involves engraving specific sigils, divine names, and planetary symbols onto materials (metals, parchment) corresponding to planetary days and hours. These are consecrated with suffumigations to imbue them with powers for protection, influence, or specific outcomes like invisibility.
Invisibility Ritual: Uses an onyx ring engraved with specific symbols, prepared under the influence of the moon, which, when worn, confers the power of invisibility.
Exorcism: Specific Latin prayers and commands are given to drive away or compel demonic entities, often involving the use of the cross and Christian references.

relevant_quotes.text: Il est bon que vous sachiez qu'avant décommencer tout ce qui est dit ci-dessus, il faut que vous ayez fait vos dévotions et que vous n'ayez plus rien à vous reprocher. Ceci est d'autant plus essentiel que s'il n'en était pas ainsi, vous seriez plutôt aux ordres de l'esprit malin qu'il ne serait aux vôtres.

EMPEREUR LUCIFER, maître de tous les esprits rebelles, je te prie de m'être favorable dans l'appellation que je fais à ton grand ministre Lucifugé Rofocale, ayant envie de faire pacte avec lui; je te prie aussi, prince Belzébuth, de me protéger dans mon entreprise. O comte Astaroth; sois-moi propice, et fais que, dans cette nuit, le grand Lucifugé m'apparaisse sous une force humaine et sans aucune mauvaise odeur, et qu'il m'accorde, par le moyen du pacte que je vais lui présenter, toutes les richesses dont j'ai besoin.
O grand Lucifugé! je suis content de toi pour le présent, je te laisse en repos, et te permets de te retirer où bon te semblera, sans faire aucun bruit ni laisser aucune mauvaise odeur.
Faites un signe de croix sur vous et sur le miroir.
La Magie naturelle devient magie noire, nous rapporterons ci après d'après ARBATEL dans son livre de Magie quels sont les esprits connus de ceux qui font pratique de ces choses.

critical_analysis.relevance: Le Véritable Dragon Rouge is a foundational text within the 'Black Hen' and 'Red Dragon' grimoire tradition, distinct but often conflated with the Grand Grimoire. It exemplifies the late 18th/early 19th-century popular grimoire genre, which synthesized earlier Solomonic (and pseudo-Solomonic) traditions with elements of folk magic, planetary magic (via Arbatel), and overt diabolism (pacts). Its practical focus on wealth acquisition, control over spirits (both infernal and celestial), and personal benefits (invisibility, beauty) made it highly influential, though often condemned. It serves as a crucial historical document for understanding the popularization and demonization of magical practices in post-Enlightenment Europe. Its structure, combining complex ritual magic with simpler folk remedies and even physiognomy/beauty secrets, reflects a broader desire for comprehensive secret knowledge, transcending a purely 'magical' focus.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The book is intended for aspiring magicians, sorcerers, and treasure hunters seeking direct engagement with spirits for material gain, protection, and various forms of divination or personal advantage. It implicitly targets those willing to undertake complex, sometimes morally ambiguous, rituals and pacts, and individuals interested in the practical application of diverse occult traditions, from demonology to planetary magic and folk superstitions. Its clear instructions suggest a practical, rather than purely philosophical, readership.
